@screwju
In VLC, just drag & drop the subtitle onto the video. Else put the subtitle file in the same folder as that of the video & rename the subtitle file the same as the video file name.
E.g. in this case the following 2 files should be in the same folder
Avatar Extended (HD).mp4
Avatar Extended (HD).srt

I think 4 Gb is GREAT enough for a 720p 3 hour movie, because if you look the 1080p rips from PS3 Team you'll see almost buray quality (actually I didn't see any differences yet) in 4 Gb 2 hour and little more movies. But... Here I'm being a jerk... This rip, as it has another video file as a source, shows too much artifaction and softened borders. You'll see artifaction in fast camera movements and characters' faces blurry in most parts of the movie where wide and normal lenses are used.
@zdude555 don't need to do any of that.
